Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: イーガ
Entry.EnglishText: Iger

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Agarte>
Entry.EnglishText: <Agarte>

Entry.JapaneseText: イゴル
Entry.EnglishText: Igor

Entry.JapaneseText: 門番
Entry.EnglishText: Gatekeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ・ヒューマ族長の家
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda - Huma Chief's House

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ・イーガの家
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda - Iger's House

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマ族長の家
Entry.EnglishText: Huma Chief's House

Entry.JapaneseText: イーガの家
Entry.EnglishText: Iger's House

Entry.JapaneseText: 見かけん顔だな。 特に、あんたのような上品な娘は、 この街では見た事がない。
Entry.EnglishText: I've never seen your faces before. And I've definitely never seen a young women as graceful as you around these parts.

Entry.JapaneseText: ボクたちは……
Entry.EnglishText: We're here to...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシは、この娘さんと 話しておる。 ワシに何の用かな？
Entry.EnglishText: I was talking to this young lady over here. Now then, what business do you have with me?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……突然の訪問をお許しください。 私たちは、カレギアの古代史を 研究している者です。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Please pardon our sudden visit. We are currently conducting research on the ancient history of Callegea.

Entry.JapaneseText: イーガ様にどうしても おうかがいしたい事があって 参りました。
Entry.EnglishText: There is something that we would like to inquire of you, if you would be gracious enough to grant us an audience.

Entry.JapaneseText: ううむ、若いのにしっかりしておる。 さすがヒューマだ…… 粗暴なガジュマでは、こうはいかん。 気に入った、何でも聞いてくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Ooh, you're rather well-spoken for your age. Very much befitting of a Huma... Those uncouth Gajuma couldn't hope to be half as poised. Please, ask me anything you like.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ありがとうございます。 早速ですが、私たちが知りたいのは <Blue>闇の力<White>の事です。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Thank you very much. My apologies for asking this outright, but we are interested in learning about the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>闇の力<White>…… あれが我らヒューマにとって、 いかなるものかは知っておろうな？
Entry.EnglishText: The <Blue>Power of Shade<White>... Are you aware of what significance that carries for us Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: 聖なるものとして崇められて いた事……そして、古代の 人々によって、どこかの泉に 沈められたという事は……
Entry.EnglishText: I am aware that it was revered by Huma as something divine, and then submerged into the depths of a spring by the people of ancient times.

Entry.JapaneseText: イーガ様なら、 その泉をご存知かと思い、 こちらへおうかがいしたのです。
Entry.EnglishText: We came to visit you, Mister Iger, because we were wondering if you have any knowledge concerning the spring.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なるほど…… あんたのような娘には、 ぜひとも教えてやりたいのだが、 ワシにもその泉はわからん。
Entry.EnglishText: I see... For a girl such as yourself, I would be glad to tell you anything you wanted to know. Alas, I don't know much about the spring.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシの知る、唯一の手がかりは <Cyan>カギ<White>だ。
Entry.EnglishText: The only thing I can tell you about is the <Cyan>key<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Cyan>カギ<White>……？
Entry.EnglishText: A <Cyan>key<White>...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシらのご先祖さまは、 <Blue>闇の力<White>を沈めた泉に<Cyan>カギ<White>をかけ、 その<Cyan>カギ<White>を<Yellow>ふたつに分けて<White>、 それぞれの種族が守る事となったそうだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Our ancestors created a <Cyan>key<White> to the spring where the <Blue>Power of Shade<White> is locked away and split it in <Yellow>two<White>. One half was given to each race for safekeeping, or so I've been told.

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、ヒューマの長たる我が家には、 <Cyan>カギ<White>など伝わっていないのだ…… もしかすると、永年の間に ガジュマに奪われたのかもしれぬ……
Entry.EnglishText: As far as I am aware, no such key has been passed down through my family. It might have been stolen by those Gajuma years and years ago.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヤツらは<Blue>闇の力<White>を 忌むべきものと考えておる。 <Cyan>カギ<White>を隠したのかもしれん……
Entry.EnglishText: They think that the <Blue>Power of Shade<White> is an abomination, so perhaps they've gone and hidden the <Cyan>key<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: カギは……ふたつ……
Entry.EnglishText: A key separated in two...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシも、手に入るものなら <Blue>闇の力<White>を手に入れて、 望みをかなえたいと思う。 だが……何もわからんのだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: If it were possible, I would love to get my hands on the <Blue>Power of Shade<White> so that I could make my dreams come true. But sadly, I don't know a thing about it.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ここは……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Where am I?

Entry.JapaneseText: お、気がついたか？ ここはラジルダの俺の家だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, you're awake. You're here in my house in Razilda.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私……どうして…… ……カレギア城に…… ……いたはずなのに……
Entry.EnglishText: How did I...? I was just in Callegea Castle...

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア城？ じゃあ、 バルカから来たのか…… どうしてあんなところに？ しかも、そんな格好で。
Entry.EnglishText: Callegea Castle? So you're from Balka, I take it? Then how did you wind up here? And in that state, no less.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何か、事情がありそうだが…… まあいい、深くは聞かん。 それより、腹は減ってないか？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm guessing something happened to you... But I'm okay with not knowing the details. Besides, you must be starving.

Entry.JapaneseText: いえ、私は……
Entry.EnglishText: No, I'm...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ははは……何か適当に みつくろって来る。 待ってな。
Entry.EnglishText: Hahaha... I'll go fix you up something to eat. Just wait here.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Is something wrong?

Entry.JapaneseText: 静かに……親父が帰ってきた。 親父は大のガジュマ嫌いでな。 見つかると面倒だ……
Entry.EnglishText: Keep your voice down... My old man's back. He's not so keen on Gajuma, so if he were to see you here, then we'd be in trouble.

Entry.JapaneseText: おいハック、行くぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: C'mon Hack, let's go.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ハック？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hack?

Entry.JapaneseText: 親父のやつ、何をコソコソと やってるんだ？ それに、あいつらは一体……
Entry.EnglishText: What was my old man whispering about? Seems like he's up to something...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……外が騒がしい……何かしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: There seems to be a commotion outside... What could be going on?

Entry.JapaneseText: まったく……イゴル坊ちゃんは ガジュマに甘くていけねえや……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't believe that Young Master Igor is going soft on Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: あーあ……イーガ様は いつ帰ってくるのやら……
Entry.EnglishText: Hrmm... I wonder when Chief Iger will come back...

Entry.JapaneseText: このガジュマめが……！いつでも勝負してやるぞ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Damn Gajuma! You'd better know that I'm always looking for a fight!

Entry.JapaneseText: 親父もフォグマもいなくなって この街も大変なんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Now that my father and Fogma are gone, this town is in deep trouble.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺がまとめていければ いいんだが……
Entry.EnglishText: Hopefully I can arbitrate between everyone...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが言う事を 聞いてくれなくて……
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma wouldn't listen to me...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと話す口は持たぬ！ 今すぐ消えうせろ！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't have time to talk to you, Gajuma! Now get out of my sight!

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダのヒューマの長たる このイーガに何用かな？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm Iger, leader of the Huma here in Razilda. What can I do for you?

Entry.JapaneseText: この辺りにあるという秘薬を 探しているのですが……
Entry.EnglishText: We're searching for a medicine that is said to be from around here.

Entry.JapaneseText: それはベルデ草から作る 鎮魂錠の事か？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you asking about the Requiem Pastille that is made from Belde Grass?

Entry.JapaneseText: 鎮魂錠？
Entry.EnglishText: The Requiem Pastille?

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダの海のように 激しく波打つ心さえ あっと言う間に 鎮める事のできる妙薬だ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's a miracle cure that can soothe a heart as turbulent as the Sea of Razilda in an instant.

Entry.JapaneseText: この土地にしか伝わらない製法ゆえ、 他の場所では珍重される。 おまえたちのように、この薬を求めて やって来る連中が時々いるのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The recipe is passed down only in this region, so it's highly sought after elsewhere. Travelers like you come here from time to time in search of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 我が同胞のためなら喜んで 分けてやらないでもないが…… 旅をしてまで手に入れたい 理由を聞かせてもらおうか？
Entry.EnglishText: I'd be more than happy to part with it for the sake of a fellow Huma, but do tell me why you came all this way to acquire it?

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカにいるオレたちの仲間の 気持ちを落ち着けるため……
Entry.EnglishText: We need it to help soothe a friend of ours in Balka.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ほう、友人を救うために、 はるばるバルカから来たのか。 なかなか感心な若者たちだ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I see, you've come all the way from Balka to help a friend of yours. You youngsters are very admirable.

Entry.JapaneseText: それで？ おまえたちの仲間は、 どんな様子なんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: So, what kind of condition is your friend in?

Entry.JapaneseText: 理由はわからないんですが、 他人への憎しみに満ちていて、 とても攻撃的で危険な状態です。
Entry.EnglishText: We have no clue why, but he's grown hateful towards others and is acting very aggressively.

Entry.JapaneseText: ホントにヤバイんだ。 早く薬を飲ませてやらないと、 <Eugene>は本当にヒューマを 殺しちまう!!
Entry.EnglishText: It's really bad! If we don't get any medicine, then <Eugene> might actually start killing Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマを殺す？ ……まさか、おまえたちが 助けようとしているのは、 ガジュマなのか!?
Entry.EnglishText: Killing Huma? You mean to tell me that the person you are trying to help is a Gajuma?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ああ…… でも、えっと……
Entry.EnglishText: Uh... What I meant to say was...

Entry.JapaneseText: 帰ってくれ!! ワシはガジュマなど 助けるつもりはない!!
Entry.EnglishText: Get the hell out! I refuse to ever help Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: だけど、<Eugene>は……
Entry.EnglishText: Hold on, <Eugene> is...

Entry.JapaneseText: 帰れと言うのが聞こえんのか？ おまえたちに薬は渡さん。
Entry.EnglishText: Did you not hear me tell you to get out? You're not getting your hands on any medicine!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……帰ろう。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Let's go.

Entry.JapaneseText: 闇の力を手に入れれば、 この街もワシらの……
Entry.EnglishText: Once we have the Power of Shade, this city will be ours...

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、こんな話、客人に 聞かすべきでなかったな。 忘れてくだされ。
Entry.EnglishText: Actually, this isn't information I should be telling my guests. Please ignore what I said.

Entry.JapaneseText: 我らヒューマは ガジュマとは違って 知的で美しい存在。
Entry.EnglishText: We Huma are intelligent and beautiful beings, unlike the Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシはいつか、この街を ヒューマだけの街にしたいと 願っておるのだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I hope one day to turn this city into a place only for Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: これは……？
Entry.EnglishText: This would be...?

Entry.JapaneseText: これはワシら一族の家紋にして、 ラジルダのヒューマの素晴らしさを 表す<Cyan>紋章<White>でもある。
Entry.EnglishText: This is my family's <Cyan>crest<White>, which also represents the brilliance of the Huma here in Razilda.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの素晴らしさを？ <Cyan>紋章<White>に使われているお花は、 バラとスズランと お見受けいたしましたが。
Entry.EnglishText: The brilliance of Razilda's Huma? The two flowers that are depicted on it appear to me to be the rose and the lily.

Entry.JapaneseText: 全く、そのとおりで ございます……
Entry.EnglishText: Why yes, madam, what an astute observation...

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、いかんいかん。 あんたと話してると不思議と 丁寧に話したくなってくる。 はっはっはっ……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, how silly of me. Talking with you made me want to adopt a more polite demeanor for some odd reason. Hahaha...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたの言うとおり、 「真実」を表すバラと、 「希望」を表すスズランが この旗には描かれておる。
Entry.EnglishText: But you're correct, the flowers embroidered on this flag are the rose of "truth" and the lily of "hope."

Entry.JapaneseText: 何かいわれが あるのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Is there any particular reason as to why they are depicted on the flag?

Entry.JapaneseText: 「闇において、我は真実に至る。 闇において、我は希望を求める」
Entry.EnglishText: "Amidst Darkness, we reach Truth. Amidst Darkness, we desire Hope."

Entry.JapaneseText: 闇の力を手にした時に、 ヒューマが得られるものを うたった、古代の<Cyan>詩<White>だ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's an ancient poem from when Huma were in possession of the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>, which details what we had gained from it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何とも言えない重みを 持った<Cyan>詩<White>だと思わんかね？
Entry.EnglishText: The depth behind those words is just indescribable, don't you think?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ、<Blue>闇の力<White>がいかに 大切なものであったかが うかがえますわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Indeed, it is apparent that the <Blue>Power of Shade<White> was something of immeasurable worth.

Entry.JapaneseText: うんうん……よかったら この旗を持って行きなさい。 きっと研究の役に立つだろう。
Entry.EnglishText: Quite right... If you'd like, you can go ahead and take this flag with you. I'm sure it will help with your research.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ありがとうございます。
Entry.EnglishText: Your generosity is much appreciated.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ホッカイスズランの花』 春になると、 小さな白い鈴状の花をつける。 季節感の少ないラジルダでは この花が咲くと春とされる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- North Sea Lilies - During spring, they produce small, white, bell-shaped flowers. In Razilda, where the seasons tend to blend together, it is considered springtime when these flowers bloom.

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん……スズラン…… なんだっけ？ なんか気になるヨ？
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... Lilies... Why do I feel like these are important?

Entry.JapaneseText: スズラン…… これは……
Entry.EnglishText: Lilies... Something about these flowers...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『アズーラハマナスの花』 ラジルダ周辺の浜辺でよく見かける花。 小さな花だが、異常に繁殖力が強く、 海岸を覆い尽くす年もある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Azura Beach Rose - A flower often seen on the beaches near Razilda. Though the flowers are small, they reproduce quickly, and some years they cover the entire coastline.

Entry.JapaneseText: キレイな花だネ。 でも……イマイチかな……
Entry.EnglishText: These flowers are pretty, but they don't seem all that important...

Entry.JapaneseText: この花は…… 別に何ってことはないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: There's nothing too special about these flowers...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『キッチン』 簡素だが、しっかりとした 作りの調理場。 こねかけのパンがある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Kitchen - A simple, but well-built kitchen. There is some bread dough in the process of being kneaded.

Entry.JapaneseText: 特に何かあるって わけでもないネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Nothing interesting here.

Entry.JapaneseText: キッチンなんて見ても 何もないわよね……
Entry.EnglishText: There doesn't seem to be anything here in the kitchen...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『タムクランローゼスの花』 重なる花弁が高貴な香りを醸す 真っ赤なバラ。 秋に花の盛りを迎える。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Tamklang Roses - A bright red rose with overlapping petals that has a noble fragrance. They reach their full bloom in autumn.

Entry.JapaneseText: バラ……バラ…… なんか気になるなあ……
Entry.EnglishText: Roses... Roses... I feel like they're important somehow...

Entry.JapaneseText: バラね…… どこかで見たわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Roses, huh... Where have I seen these before...?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ヒューマの栄光』 何がどうヒューマなのか、 何がどう栄光なのか、一切不明。 作品の題名を見ただけで、 イーガが気に入って購入した作品。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- The Glory of Huma - It is not clear how it represents either Huma or glory, but Iger purchased it just because of its title.
